tidysq 1.0
  • Reference

Convert sq object into character vector

Source: R/methods_sq.R
as.character.sq.Rd

Coerce sequences from a sq object to character vector of sequences

# S3 method for sq
as.character(x, ...)

Arguments

x

a sq object to be converted
...

further arguments to be passed from or to other methods.

Value

A character vector of the length the same as number of sequences in the converted sq object

Details

This method for class sq allows converting sequences from the sq object into a character vector of length equal to the length of sq. Each element of resulting vector is a seperate sequence. All attributes of the input sq are lost during the conversion to character vector.

See also

sq

Examples

# Creating an object to work on:
sq_nuc <- construct_sq(c("CTGAATGCAGTACCGTAAT", "ATGCCGTAAATGCCAT",
                         "CAGACCANNNATAG"), type = 'nuc')

# Converting the sq object into a character vector:
as.character(sq_nuc)
#> [1] "CTGAATGCAGTACCGTAAT" "ATGCCGTAAATGCCAT"    "CAGACCANNNATAG"
